result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig Chandler

records.addlTxt: All previously conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Craig Chandler appeared in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Craig Chandler.  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case recalled from this morning. For reasons stated on the record, Court reinstates bail at $500.00. Defense requests preliminary hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Craig Chandler not in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Craig Chandler.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Cash Bond previously posted remains on deposit and  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Craig Chandler in court.  
Attorney Sammuel  Obscherning appears in court with defendant. 
Attorney Stephan Nolten for William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter before the Court for Bench Warrant Return.  
Defense counsel provides explanation of defendant's non appearance.
Court Reinstated cash bail and the Conditions of Bond.
Defendant to provide proof of hospitalizaion. 
Defendant is Eligible for a Public Defender Representation. 
Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing before Preliminary Court on October 17, 2022 at 8:30am

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on  10-3-2022.
Original  bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for  Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 19.
State Public Defender notified counsel is needed at the next hearing and provided the next court date.
Return of Warrant scheduled October 7, 2022 at  8:30am
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Craig Chandler not in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER/ JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Craig Chandler not in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Reed appeared as a representative for the State Public Defender's Office. The State Public Defender's office has not yet appointed counsel.   Defendant does not appear. Court ordered a bench WARRANT issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Craig Chandler not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Craig Chandler not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with Bayshore Mall.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Craig Chandler in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Craig Chandler in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Craig Chandler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
